page.title: 09AN INTERVIEW
page.content:
"I am a working housewife in my early thirties. I am married with three children and live in the Fordhouses area. I work as a shelf packer in Sainsbury's Supermarket and earn twenty pounds for 12 hours a week. I do not like my work because it is heavy and I have to work in the evenings. I would prefer to be a library assistant but it would be a difficult job to obtain as I do not have the qualifications.
The local environment is quite nice in some parts but is very untidy in some others. It could be improved by more leisure facilities and food shops.
There is a need for places where young people could meet. I think that the greatest cause for concern in the area is vandalism and the danger of being mugged."
